snippet: The police said at least 11 mezuzot were burned at a Williamsburg building, and they are treating the burnings as a hate crime.
abstract: New York City Police Department's Hate Crime Task Force is investigating fires that were set, destroying nearly a dozen mezuzot, Jewish religious symbols, attached to residents’ front doors in Taylor-Wythe Houses, a public housing complex in Williamsburg, Brooklyn; burnings coincided with Holocaust Remembrance Day, but police say they do not know if that was a factor.

byline.original: By MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ and CHRISTOPHER MAAG

lead_paragraph: The police said at least 11 mezuzot were burned at a Williamsburg building, and they are treating the burnings as a hate crime.

headline.seo: Jewish Religious Symbols Found Burned at Brooklyn Building
